The claim is attributed to U: S. Rep. Tom Graves, R-Georgia, who accused President Barack Obama of killing "42,000 jobs" with his veto of the Keystone XL pipeline.
The claim is based on a report issued by: which estimated that the pipeline project would support 42,000 jobs during its construction phase, with most jobs lasting no more than a year or two.
PolitiFact has previously fact: checked and rated several pipeline-related jobs claims, including one from President Obama, as "False" on the Truth-O-Meter.
The CEO of TransCanada: the company behind the pipeline, made a statement in November 2014 claiming that the 42,000 jobs would be "ongoing and enduring," which was also rated as "False" by fact-checkers.
